STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 14, 2023
Barbara LaRue
Grand Traverse/Leelanau/Kalkaska DHHS
701 S Elmwood Ave Ste 19,
Traverse City, MI, 49684-3185
RE: License#: CP280201153
Dear Ms. LaRue:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on November 9, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, Area Manager, at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial
removal and at least once every 90 calendar days
thereafter.
Four foster care files were reviewed. One of four files documented a late report.
Repeat Violation Established:
0 1/23/23 Interim, CAP Approved 03/08/23.
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
(3) An agency shall provide the licensee an
application for renewal of the license and
document the action not less than 60 calendar days
before the expiration date of the license. A renewal
application must be provided to a licensee,
regardless of any pending recommendation for
disciplinary action of the license.

Three foster home files were reviewed. One of three documented that the
application was sent to the licensee more than sixty days from the date of
renewal.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
FTMs must occur within the required time frames
as outlined.
Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date.
The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is
used to capture family demographics, FTM
logistical information, needs, strengths, action
steps, safety concerns and the safety plan, and any
recommendations made for the family during the
FTM. The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report,
must be completed for every FTM.
Four foster care files and thirteen FTM’s were reviewed. Three of four files
contained FTM’s that did not occur within the specified time frames or the DHS-
1105’s were not completed.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• Technical assistance was not provided at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period. The agency submitted an approved CAP on March 8, 2023, in
response to those rule and policy violations established during the interim
inspection completed on January 23, 2023. The CAP was successful in preventing
repeat violations except for R 400. 12418, as the agency had one late report
established during the current renewal inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators assessment was submitted and reviewed. The
assessment was thorough and detailed. The assessment documented agency

efforts to comply with the interim audit CAP submitted on March 8, 2023. The
assessment also discussed under staffing and new staff as burdens that created
increased caseloads for existing staff. The assessment further addressed
disrupted placements that were mainly due to medical and/or psychiatric
hospitalizations.
Financial Overview
N/A as DHHS local office.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported feeling supported by the agency administration and their
supervisors. Staff further reported that they feel they are part of a supportive team.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is a local DHHS office. The agency is spacious and well maintained.
CHRI documentation was stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Field Analyst did not establish any safety alerts during the licensing period.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
November 13, 2023
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 14, 2023

Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
